channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 非洲正在像其他任何大陆一样，与敌对势力周旋。非洲领导人需要在巨大的机遇和严峻的风险之间取得平衡 👇。
item.description:
Africa is juggling rival powers like no other continent. Its leaders need to balance vast opportunities against dire risks https://t.co/jJgRpj8gqA 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 财政可持续性规则给英超联赛带来了巨大的混乱。现在，英格兰足球正在经历一场财政风暴 ⚽
item.description:
Financial-sustainability rules have caused an almighty mess in the Premier League. Now English football is having a financial fracas https://t.co/6GvjjygpFh ⚽

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 西方正在输掉制裁战争吗？@alice_fulwood, @Birdyword 和 @TomLeeDevlin 在本周的 "Money Talks "播客中进行了调查： 👇
item.description:
Is the West losing its sanctions war? @alice_fulwood, @Birdyword and @TomLeeDevlin investigate on this week’s “Money Talks” podcast: https://t.co/Q4j7WBBBL1 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 即使人工智能注定会彻底改变社会，今天的投资者可能也很难选择哪些公司会赚钱。互联网热潮的信徒们对互联网变革力量的判断并没有错，但他们还是赔了夫人又折兵 👇。
item.description:
Even if AI is destined to transform societies utterly, today’s investors may struggle to pick which companies will make money. Believers in the dotcom boom were not wrong about the transformative power of the internet—but they still lost their shirts https://t.co/P5IaKIXScX 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 本应阻止唐纳德-特朗普的人是一位不受欢迎的 81 岁老人。乔-拜登和他的政党正梦游般地走向灾难，原因之一就是民主党人的懦弱和自满👇。
item.description:
The man supposed to stop Donald Trump is an unpopular 81-year-old. One reason Joe Biden and his party are sleepwalking towards disaster is the Democrats' cowardice and complacency https://t.co/n4RB9Uwwle 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: IMAX 的成功表明，在日渐萎缩的电影业中，IMAX 的利基正在不断扩大。影院可能正在消亡，但高端影院正在蓬勃发展👇。
item.description:
The success of IMAX points to a growing niche in a shrinking industry. Cinemas may be dying—but the high end is thriving https://t.co/0qJgXuB02G 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: IMAX 不可能取得的成功体现了一种趋势：当看电影从一种固定的习惯变成一种偶尔的享受时，最豪华的影院正在蓬勃发展👇。
item.description:
The improbable success of IMAX exempli­ﬁes a trend: as cinema-­going changes from a regular habit into an occasional treat, the fanciest theatres are prosper­ing https://t.co/90Fl6A1N4H 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 当外国老板访问印度时，他们仍然会向德里的国家政府致敬，但许多最令人兴奋的商业机会都需要飞往南部。
item.description:
When foreign bosses visit India they still pay tribute to the national government in Delhi, but many of the most exciting business opportunities require a flight to the south.

Resolving geographical tensions will be crucial to the country’s growth https://t.co/tVdcdDxqtE 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 贫穷的肯尼亚人被当作经济实验中的小白鼠。当内罗毕的人们无法获得清洁饮用水时，几乎没有人知道他们是随机对照试验的一部分。
item.description:
Poor Kenyans are being used as guinea pigs in economic experiments.

When people in Nairobi were left without access to clean water, virtually none of them knew that they were part of a randomised controlled trial https://t.co/1q1utq9fIH

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 阿根廷的足球俱乐部正在衰落，尽管其国家队在世界上名列前茅。阿根廷最近当选的总统哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）认为，私人投资的缺乏是造成俱乐部足球状况不佳的罪魁祸首⚽️。
item.description:
Argentina’s football clubs are in decline, even as its national team ranks best in the world. Javier Milei, the country’s recently elected president, believes that a lack of private investment is to blame for the sorry state of club football https://t.co/f2MkRNrGRr ⚽️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 一位千禧一代正在建造美国第一座镍钴精炼厂。但事实证明，这在道德上比她预想的要棘手👇。
item.description:
A millennial is building America’s first nickel-cobalt refinery. But it’s proving ethically trickier than she expected https://t.co/sYK245neAU 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 芬太尼仍然是美国有史以来面临的最致命的祸害之一。自乔-拜登就任总统以来，联邦政府用于治疗的资金首次超过了用于禁药的资金👇。
item.description:
Fentanyl remains one of the deadliest scourges America has ever faced. Since Joe Biden became president, the federal government has, for the first time, devoted more money to treatment than to prohibition https://t.co/FUIiqYpYIv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 世界上最高的 1000 座建筑中，只有 7 座位于欧盟。许多人可能会说，但愿这种情况永远保持下去。充满广场和林荫大道的欧洲大陆不需要这样的纪念碑来纪念特朗普式的开发商的自大👇。
item.description:
Only seven of the world’s 1,000 tallest buildings are in the EU. And long may that remain the case, many might say. A continent of piazzas and tree-lined boulevards needs no such monuments to the Trumpian egos of developers https://t.co/cnUB1l1GhN 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 看来，美国股票市场的价值集中与日益被动的所有权之间可能存在联系。不假思索的资金的崛起正在扼杀许多愿意押注经济下滑的人 👇
item.description:
It seems likely that there is a connection between the concentration of value in America’s stockmarket and its increasingly passive ownership. The rise of unthinking money is killing off many of those willing to bet on a downturn https://t.co/Tf9xvNNYBo 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: "研究人员对疫苗有可能消灭多发性硬化症感到兴奋"。@AinslieJstone 告诉 "巴贝奇"，为什么抗击多发性硬化症有了新希望。收听播客： 🎧
item.description:
“Researchers are excited that a vaccine could potentially wipe out MS.” @AinslieJstone tells “Babbage” why there is new hope in the fight against multiple sclerosis. Listen to the podcast: https://t.co/jM1tVxoDSz 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 无论人工智能生成的文本听起来多么流畅和自信，它仍然不可信。如何才能控制幻觉呢？
item.description:
No matter how fluent and confident AI-generated text sounds, it still cannot be trusted. How can hallucinations be controlled?

It is hard to do so without also limiting models’ power: https://t.co/n46ThOP1Be 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 让球迷的视线从比赛中移开是很困难的。但对于英格兰足球超级联赛的埃弗顿队来说，本赛季最关键的时刻是律师小组的两次裁决： 汤姆-詹金斯/《卫报》/Eyevine
item.description:
Dragging football fans’ eyes away from a game is difficult. But for Everton of the English Premier League, the season’s most critical moments have been two rulings by panels of lawyers: https://t.co/5yq8G1bFY7

Image: Tom Jenkins/Guardian/Eyevine pic.twitter.com/Ovf6CC3vEq

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 专制国家正试图监督和控制其侨民。要保护其海外批评者，就必须坚持开放的价值观，因为正是这种价值观促使人们开始寻找新家👇。
item.description:
Autocracies are trying to monitor and control their diasporas. Protecting their critics abroad requires upholding the values of openness which led people to find a new home in the first place https://t.co/a3TI4liFzF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 那些想对俄罗斯被冻结的资金采取行动的人是对的，但如何采取行动关系重大。直接扣押资产将是一个错误👇。
item.description:
Those who want to do something with Russia’s frozen money are right, but how it is done matters greatly. Seizing the assets outright would be a mistake https://t.co/nm8HGtFmqQ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 来自 @ManhattanInst 的 Nicole Gelinas 说埃里克-亚当斯还有很多工作要做。"市长的主要成就是什么？我们还不太清楚，"她告诉我们的 "制衡 "播客 👇。
item.description:
Nicole Gelinas from @ManhattanInst says Eric Adams has work to do. ”What is the mayor’s major accomplishment going to be? We still don’t really know,” she tells our “Checks and Balance” podcast https://t.co/4IOi6vxIuY 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 有些聊天机器人实验比其他实验更有用。这就是企业使用生成式人工智能的实际情况👇。
item.description:
Some experiments with chatbots are more useful than others. This is how businesses are actually using generative AI https://t.co/JNcadrW8fF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 由于反对党四分五裂，似乎无法对纳伦德拉-莫迪发起严峻挑战，印度农民可能会对总理今年顺利重新掌权构成最大威胁。了解他们再次抗议的原因： 👇
item.description:
With a fractured opposition that looks unable to mount a serious challenge to Narendra Modi, India’s farmers could pose the biggest threat to the prime minister’s smooth return to power this year.

Read why they are protesting again: https://t.co/MEHsW5hiFO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 您能猜出这些摘录是哪一年在《经济学人》上发表的吗？ 👇
item.description:
Can you guess which year these extracts were published in The Economist? https://t.co/FGy6F6dfxq 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 这就是为什么威士忌能在其他商品失败的地方取得成功： 🥃
item.description:
Whisky is an outlier when it comes to premium Western consumables in China.

This is why it is succeeding where other goods have failed: https://t.co/VdAOGDGEOA 🥃

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 摄入更少的卡路里可以防止衰老 👇
item.description:
Eating fewer calories can ward off ageing https://t.co/gm8DIjHqEx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: Nvidia 主导着人工智能芯片制造。任何希望取代这家半导体巨头的竞争对手都需要在三大领域击败它。请阅读这将是一项艰巨任务的原因： 👇
item.description:
Nvidia dominates AI chipmaking. Any competitor hoping to displace the semiconductor behemoth will need to beat it in three big areas.

Read why that will be a tall order: https://t.co/7QXRWcBlXi 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 四分之三的年轻选民不赞成乔-拜登对加沙问题的处理。这对他的连任竞选意味着什么？
item.description:
Three-quarters of young voters disapprove of Joe Biden’s handling of Gaza. What does that mean for his re-election campaign? https://t.co/iggrCJ3WUn pic.twitter.com/0chxVnVxHn

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: Mistral 成立不到一年，目前仍只有 25 名员工。然而，这家法国人工智能初创公司的估值却超过了 20 亿美元。其早期成功的背后是什么？ 👇
item.description:
Mistral was founded less than a year ago and still has just 25 employees. Yet the French AI startup is valued at more than $2bn. What’s behind its early success? https://t.co/iGCAImQTDR 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 我们的互动工具可让您探索英国选民中的 900,000 个群体，这些群体是根据八个人口特征定义的。使用分享按钮展示您的作品 #BuildABritishVoter 🇬🇧
item.description:
Our interactive tool allows you to explore 900,000 groups within Britain’s electorate, defined according to eight demographic characteristics.

What does your voter look like? Use the share button to show off your creation https://t.co/kZVca5LTTc #BuildABritishVoter 🇬🇧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024

item.title: 英国穆斯林对工党的支持正在动摇。但在下次大选中，这种支持率下降的后果将是有限的，原因有两个 👇
item.description:
British Muslims’ support for Labour is wobbling. But the consequences of this decline in support at the next general election would be limited for two reasons https://t.co/DXS3FTKmn6 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 3, 2024
